Religious sacrificial ceremonies

From ancient times, what emperor who received the mandate did not perform the feng and shan sacrifices? There have been those who performed the rites without the proper omens, but never those who saw auspicious signs appear and did not proceed to Mount Tai. Though they received the mandate, their achievements did not reach the required level; or reaching Liang Fu, their virtue was not in harmony; or being in harmony, they lacked the leisure timeâ€”so the rites were rarely performed. The tradition says: 'Three years without performing the rites, the rites must fall into disuse; three years without performing music, the music must deteriorate.' In each flourishing era, the feng and shan sacrifices respond to it; when it declines, they cease. The distant ones were over a thousand years ago, the nearer ones several hundred years agoâ€”therefore their rites have gaps and are buried in oblivion; their details cannot be obtained and recorded, it is said.

The Shang Shu says: Shun was at the Xuan Ji and Yu Heng, using them to align the seven governances. Then he offered sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, made yin offerings to the six ancestors, gazed at the mountains and rivers, and universally to all spirits. He collected the five auspicious tokens, selected auspicious months and days, met with the four peak lords and all the shepherds, and returned the auspicious tokens. In the year's second month, he conducted the eastern inspection tour, arriving at Dai Zong. Dai Zong is Mount Tai. He performed the chai sacrifice, gazing in order at the mountains and rivers. Then he held audience with the eastern lords. The eastern lords are the feudal lords. He harmonized the seasons, months, and first days; standardized the pitch pipes, measures, and balances; repaired the five rites; and prepared the five jades, three silks, two living animals, and one dead animal as tribute. In the fifth month, he conducted the inspection tour to the southern peak. The southern peak is Mount Heng. In the eighth month, he conducted the inspection tour to the western peak. The western peak is Mount Hua. In the eleventh month, he conducted the inspection tour to the northern peak. The northern peak is Mount Heng. All were performed according to Dai Zong's rites. The central peak is Mount Song Gao. Once every five years he conducted the inspection tour.
3
ç¦¹éµä¹‹ã€‚ å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œè‡³å¸å­”ç”²ï¼Œæ·«å¾·å¥½ç¥ï¼Œç¥ç€†ï¼ŒäºŒé¾å»ä¹‹ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä¸‰ä¸–ï¼Œæ¹¯ä¼æ¡€ï¼Œæ¬²é·å¤ç¤¾ï¼Œä¸å¯ï¼Œä½œå¤ç¤¾ã€‚ å¾Œå…«ä¸–ï¼Œè‡³å¸å¤ªæˆŠï¼Œæœ‰æ¡‘è°·ç”Ÿæ–¼å»·ï¼Œä¸€æš®å¤§æ‹±ï¼Œæ‡¼ã€‚ ä¼Šé™Ÿæ›°ï¼šã€Œå¦–ä¸å‹å¾·ã€‚ã€ å¤ªæˆŠä¿®å¾·ï¼Œæ¡‘è°·æ­»ã€‚ ä¼Šé™Ÿè´Šå·«å’¸ï¼Œå·«å’¸ä¹‹èˆˆè‡ªæ­¤å§‹ã€‚ å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œå¸æ­¦ä¸å¾—å‚…èªªç‚ºç›¸ï¼Œæ®·å¾©èˆˆç„‰ï¼Œç¨±é«˜å®—ã€‚ æœ‰é›‰ç™»é¼è€³é›Šï¼Œæ­¦ä¸æ‡¼ã€‚ ç¥–å·±æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¿®å¾·ã€‚ã€ æ­¦ä¸å¾ä¹‹ï¼Œä½ä»¥æ°¸å¯§ã€‚ å¾Œäº”ä¸–ï¼Œå¸æ­¦ä¹™æ…¢ç¥è€Œéœ‡æ­»ã€‚ å¾Œä¸‰ä¸–ï¼Œå¸ç´‚æ·«äº‚ï¼Œæ­¦ç‹ä¼ä¹‹ã€‚ ç”±æ­¤è§€ä¹‹ï¼Œå§‹æœªå˜—ä¸è‚…ç¥—ï¼Œå¾Œç¨æ€ æ…¢ä¹Ÿã€‚
Yu followed this practice. Fourteen generations later, Emperor Kong Jia had licentious virtue and was fond of spirits; he profaned the spirits, so the two dragons left him. Three generations later, Tang attacked Jie; he wished to move the Xia altar but it was not possible, so he made a Xia altar. Eight generations later, Emperor Tai Wu had mulberry and grain growing in his court; in one evening they grew to embrace each other greatly, causing fear. Yi Zhi said: 'Demons cannot overcome virtue.' Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry and grain died. Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this. Fourteen generations later, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as his minister; Yin was revived thereupon, and he was called Gao Zong. A pheasant ascended the cauldron's ears and crowed; Wu Ding was afraid. Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.' Wu Ding followed this advice, and his position was eternally peaceful. Five generations later, Emperor Wu Yi disrespected the spirits and was killed by thunder. Three generations later, Emperor Zhou was licentious and chaotic; Wu Wang attacked him. From this we can see that at the beginning they were never not solemn and respectful, but later they became somewhat negligent.

å‘¨å®˜æ›°ï¼Œå†¬æ—¥è‡³ï¼Œç¥€å¤©æ–¼å—éƒŠï¼Œè¿é•·æ—¥ä¹‹è‡³ï¼› å¤æ—¥è‡³ï¼Œç¥­åœ°ç¥—ã€‚ çš†ç”¨æ¨‚èˆï¼Œè€Œç¥ä¹ƒå¯å¾—è€Œç¦®ä¹Ÿã€‚ å¤©å­ç¥­å¤©ä¸‹åå±±å¤§å·ï¼Œäº”å¶½è¦–ä¸‰å…¬ï¼Œå››ç€†è¦–è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯ç¥­å…¶ç–†å…§åå±±å¤§å·ã€‚ å››ç€†è€…ï¼Œæ±Ÿã€æ²³ã€æ·®ã€æ¿Ÿä¹Ÿã€‚ å¤©å­æ›°æ˜å ‚ã€è¾Ÿé›ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ›°æ³®å®®ã€‚
The Zhou officials say: when the winter solstice arrives, sacrifice to heaven at the southern suburb, welcoming the arrival of longer days; when the summer solstice arrives, sacrifice to the earth spirits. All use music and dance, and only then can the spirits be obtained and properly ritualized. The Son of Heaven sacrifices to all the famous mountains and great rivers under heaven: the five peaks are treated like the three dukes; the four rivers are treated like the feudal lords; the feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories. The four rivers are the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji. The Son of Heaven calls them the Bright Hall and Pi Yong; the feudal lords call them the Pan Palace.

å‘¨å…¬æ—¢ç›¸æˆç‹ï¼ŒéƒŠç¥€åç¨·ä»¥é…å¤©ï¼Œå®—ç¥€æ–‡ç‹æ–¼æ˜å ‚ä»¥é…ä¸Šå¸ã€‚ è‡ªç¦¹èˆˆè€Œä¿®ç¤¾ç¥€ï¼Œåç¨·ç¨¼ç©¡ï¼Œæ•…æœ‰ç¨·ç¥ ï¼ŒéƒŠç¤¾æ‰€å¾ä¾†å°šçŸ£ã€‚
After Duke Zhou assisted Cheng Wang, he performed the suburban sacrifice to Hou Ji to match with Heaven, and the ancestral sacrifice to Wen Wang in the Bright Hall to match with the Supreme Deity. Since Yu rose and repaired the altar sacrifices, and Hou Ji handled farming and harvesting, therefore there is the Ji temple; the suburban and altar sacrifices have come from ancient times.

è‡ªå‘¨å…‹æ®·å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œä¸–ç›Šè¡°ï¼Œç¦®æ¨‚å»¢ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ£è¡Œï¼Œè€Œå¹½ç‹ç‚ºçŠ¬æˆæ‰€æ•—ï¼Œå‘¨æ±å¾™é›’é‚‘ã€‚ ç§¦è¥„å…¬æ”»æˆæ•‘å‘¨ï¼Œå§‹åˆ—ç‚ºè«¸ä¾¯ã€‚ ç§¦è¥„å…¬æ—¢ä¾¯ï¼Œå±…è¥¿å‚ï¼Œè‡ªä»¥ç‚ºä¸»å°‘çšä¹‹ç¥ï¼Œä½œè¥¿ç•¤ï¼Œç¥ ç™½å¸ï¼Œå…¶ç‰²ç”¨é¨®é§’é»ƒç‰›ç¾ç¾Šå„ä¸€äº‘ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œåå…­å¹´ï¼Œç§¦æ–‡å…¬æ±çµæ±§æ¸­ä¹‹é–’ï¼Œåœå±…ä¹‹è€Œå‰ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬å¤¢é»ƒè›‡è‡ªå¤©ä¸‹å±¬åœ°ï¼Œå…¶å£æ­¢æ–¼é„œè¡ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬å•å²æ•¦ï¼Œæ•¦æ›°ï¼šã€Œæ­¤ä¸Šå¸ä¹‹å¾µï¼Œå›å…¶ç¥ ä¹‹ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä½œé„œç•¤ï¼Œç”¨ä¸‰ç‰²éƒŠç¥­ç™½å¸ç„‰ã€‚
From Zhou's conquest of Yin, after fourteen generations, each generation increasingly declined; rites and music were wasted; feudal lords conducted themselves unrestrainedly; You Wang was defeated by the Quan Rong; Zhou moved east to Luo city. Qin Xiang Gong attacked the Rong to save Zhou, and began to be ranked among the feudal lords. After Qin Xiang Gong became marquis and dwelt on the western border, he considered himself master of Shao Hao's spirit, made the western zhi altar, sacrificed to the White Emperor, using as sacrificial animals one sorrel colt, one yellow ox, and one ram sheep each, it is said. Sixteen years later, Qin Wen Gong went east hunting between the Qian and Wei rivers; he divined about dwelling there and it was auspicious. Wen Gong dreamed of a yellow snake descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan. Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is an omen from the Supreme Deity; my lord should sacrifice to it.' Thereupon he made the Fu zhi altar, using three sacrificial animals to perform the suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor.

Before the Fu zhi was made, beside Yong there were originally the Wu Yang Wu zhi and east of Yong the Hao zhi, but all were abandoned without sacrifice. Some say: 'From ancient times, Yong province has been piled high, a recess for spirits and brightness; therefore the zhi altars were established to suburb-sacrifice the Supreme Deity, and all the various spirit sacrifices gathered there as clouds. The Yellow Emperor once used these affairs, and even late Zhou also performed the suburban sacrifices there.' These words are not seen in the classics; officials do not speak of them.

ä½œé„œç•¤å¾Œä¹å¹´ï¼Œæ–‡å…¬ç²è‹¥çŸ³é›²ï¼Œäºé™³å€‰åŒ—é˜ªåŸç¥ ä¹‹ã€‚ å…¶ç¥æˆ–æ­²ä¸è‡³ï¼Œæˆ–æ­²æ•¸ä¾†ï¼Œä¾†ä¹Ÿå¸¸ä»¥å¤œï¼Œå…‰è¼è‹¥æµæ˜Ÿï¼Œå¾æ±å—ä¾†é›†äºç¥ åŸï¼Œå‰‡è‹¥é›„é›ï¼Œå…¶è²æ®·é›²ï¼Œé‡é›å¤œé›Šã€‚ ä»¥ä¸€ç‰¢ç¥ ï¼Œå‘½æ›°é™³å¯¶ã€‚
Nine years after making the Fu zhi, Wen Gong obtained something like a stone cloud; he walled it at the north slope of Chen Cang and sacrificed to it. Its spirit sometimes did not arrive for a year, sometimes came several times a year; when it came it was always at night, radiant like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrificial walled area, crowing like a male chicken with a rumbling sound like thunder, and wild chickens crowing at night. He sacrificed with one pen of sacrificial animals, naming it Chen Bao.

ä½œé„œç•¤å¾Œä¸ƒåå…«å¹´ï¼Œç§¦å¾·å…¬æ—¢ç«‹ï¼Œåœå±…é›ï¼Œã€Œå¾Œå­å­«é£²é¦¬æ–¼æ²³ã€ï¼Œé‚éƒ½é›ã€‚ é›ä¹‹è«¸ç¥ è‡ªæ­¤èˆˆã€‚ ç”¨ä¸‰ç™¾ç‰¢æ–¼é„œç•¤ã€‚ ä½œä¼ç¥ ã€‚ ç£”ç‹—é‚‘å››é–€ï¼Œä»¥å¾¡è ±è‘ã€‚
Seventy-eight years after making the Fu zhi, Qin De Gong was already established; he divined about dwelling in Yong: 'Later descendants will drink their horses at the river,' and then made Yong his capital. Yong's various sacrifices rose from this. He used three hundred pens of sacrificial animals at the Fu zhi. He made the hidden sacrifice. He had dogs torn apart and walled them at the four gates, to resist poison and calamities.

å¾·å…¬ç«‹äºŒå¹´å’ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œï¼ˆå…­ï¼‰ï¼»å››ï¼½å¹´ï¼Œç§¦å®£å…¬ä½œå¯†ç•¤æ–¼æ¸­å—ï¼Œç¥­é’å¸ã€‚
De Gong died in his second year of rule. Four years later, Qin Xuan Gong made the Mi zhi altar south of the Wei River, sacrificing to the Green Emperor.

å…¶å¾Œåå››å¹´ï¼Œç§¦ç¹†å…¬ç«‹ï¼Œç—…è‡¥äº”æ—¥ä¸å¯¤ï¼› å¯¤ï¼Œä¹ƒè¨€å¤¢è¦‹ä¸Šå¸ï¼Œä¸Šå¸å‘½ç¹†å…¬å¹³æ™‰äº‚ã€‚ å²æ›¸è€Œè¨˜è—ä¹‹åºœã€‚ è€Œå¾Œä¸–çš†æ›°ç§¦ç¹†å…¬ä¸Šå¤©ã€‚
Fourteen years later, Qin Mu Gong was established; he fell ill and lay unconscious for five days; when he awoke, he spoke of dreaming that he saw the Supreme Deity, who commanded Mu Gong to pacify the chaos in Jin. The historian wrote it down and recorded it, storing it in the treasury. And later generations all said that Qin Mu Gong ascended to heaven.

In Qin Mu Gong's ninth year on the throne, Qi Huan Gong was already hegemon; he assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu and wished to perform the feng and shan sacrifices. Guan Zhong said: 'In ancient times, those who performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Liang Fu numbered seventy-two families, and of those that Yi Wu recorded there are twelve. Formerly, the Wu Huai Shi performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Chu Xi performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Shen Nong performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; The Yan Emperor performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Ting Ting; Zhuan Xu performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Emperor Ku performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Yao performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Shun performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Yu performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Hui Ji; Tang performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on Yun Yun; Zhou Cheng Wang performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan on She Shou: all received the mandate before they could perform feng and shan.' Huan Gong said: 'I attacked the Shan Rong in the north, passed through Gu Zhu; attacked Da Xia in the west, crossed the Flowing Sands, bound the horses and hung the chariots, ascended Bei Er Mountain; attacked south to Zhao Ling, ascended Xiong Er Mountain to gaze at the Jiang and Han rivers. I assembled war chariots three times and carriages six times, united the feudal lords nine times, rectified all under heaven once, and no feudal lord defied me. The former Three Dynasties received the mandateâ€”what was different about that?' Thereupon Guan Zhong saw that Huan Gong could not be convinced with words alone, so he set forth the requirements, saying: 'For ancient feng and shan ceremonies, there must be the millet from Xiang Shang and grain from Bei Li to make them abundant; between the Jiang and Huai, there must be thatch with three ridges to serve as the mat. The East Sea must present fish that swim side by side, the West Sea must present birds that fly together, then there will be fifteen kinds of things that come without being summoned. Now phoenixes and qilins do not come, auspicious grains do not grow, but cogon grass and thorns flourish, owls arrive frequentlyâ€”yet you wish to perform feng and shan; would that not be impossible?' Thereupon Huan Gong stopped. This year, Qin Mu Gong installed Yi Wu as lord of Jin. Afterward he established three lords for the state of Jin and pacified their chaos. Mu Gong ruled for thirty-nine years and died.

å…¶å¾Œç™¾æœ‰é¤˜å¹´ï¼Œè€Œå­”å­è«–è¿°å…­è—ï¼Œå‚³ç•¥è¨€æ˜“å§“è€Œç‹ï¼Œå°æ³°å±±ç¦ªä¹æ¢çˆ¶è€…ä¸ƒåé¤˜ç‹çŸ£ï¼Œå…¶ä¿è±†ä¹‹ç¦®ä¸ç« ï¼Œè“‹é›£è¨€ä¹‹ã€‚ æˆ–å•ç¦˜ä¹‹èªªï¼Œå­”å­æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¸çŸ¥ã€‚ çŸ¥ç¦˜ä¹‹èªªï¼Œå…¶æ–¼å¤©ä¸‹ä¹Ÿè¦–å…¶æŒã€‚ã€ è©©äº‘ç´‚åœ¨ä½ï¼Œæ–‡ç‹å—å‘½ï¼Œæ”¿ä¸åŠæ³°å±±ã€‚ æ­¦ç‹å…‹æ®·äºŒå¹´ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹æœªå¯§è€Œå´©ã€‚ çˆ°å‘¨å¾·ä¹‹æ´½ç¶­æˆç‹ï¼Œæˆç‹ä¹‹å°ç¦ªå‰‡è¿‘ä¹‹çŸ£ã€‚ åŠå¾Œé™ªè‡£åŸ·æ”¿ï¼Œå­£æ°æ—…æ–¼æ³°å±±ï¼Œä»²å°¼è­ä¹‹ã€‚
A hundred years later, Confucius discussed and described the six arts, transmitted briefly that those who changed surnames and became kings, who performed feng on Tai Mountain and shan at Liang Fu, numbered seventy kings already; their sacrificial vessel rites are not clear, probably because they are difficult to speak of. Someone asked about the explanation of the di sacrifice; Confucius said: 'I do not know. One who knows the explanation of the di sacrifice could hold all under heaven in the palm of his hand.' The Shi says: While Zhou was in power, Wen Wang received the mandate; his governance did not reach Tai Mountain. Wu Wang conquered Yin in two years, but all under heaven was not yet peaceful when he died. Thus it was only with Cheng Wang that Zhou virtue was in harmony; Cheng Wang's feng and shan came close to it. Later when retainer ministers governed, the Ji family traveled to Tai Mountain; Zhong Ni ridiculed this.

æ˜¯æ™‚è‡å¼˜ä»¥æ–¹äº‹å‘¨éˆç‹ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯è«æœå‘¨ï¼Œå‘¨åŠ›å°‘ï¼Œè‡å¼˜ä¹ƒæ˜é¬¼ç¥äº‹ï¼Œè¨­å°„è²é¦–ã€‚ è²é¦–è€…ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯ä¹‹ä¸ä¾†è€…ã€‚ ä¾ç‰©æ€ªæ¬²ä»¥è‡´è«¸ä¾¯ã€‚ è«¸ä¾¯ä¸å¾ï¼Œè€Œæ™‰äººåŸ·æ®ºè‡å¼˜ã€‚ å‘¨äººä¹‹è¨€æ–¹æ€ªè€…è‡ªè‡å¼˜ã€‚
At this time Chang Hong served Zhou Ling Wang with his methods; no feudal lords attended Zhou court; Zhou's strength was weak; Chang Hong then clarified matters of ghosts and spirits, establishing the shooting of the li head. The li head represented the feudal lords who did not come. He relied on monstrous things in hopes of attracting the feudal lords. The feudal lords did not follow, and the Jin people seized and killed Chang Hong. The Zhou people's talk of methods and monsters began with Chang Hong.

å…¶å¾Œç™¾é¤˜å¹´ï¼Œç§¦éˆå…¬ä½œå³é™½ä¸Šç•¤ï¼Œç¥­é»ƒå¸ï¼› ä½œä¸‹ç•¤ï¼Œç¥­ç‚å¸ã€‚
A hundred years later, Qin Ling Gong made the Wu Yang upper zhi altar and sacrificed to the Yellow Emperor; he made the lower zhi altar and sacrificed to the Yan Emperor.

å¾Œå››åå…«å¹´ï¼Œå‘¨å¤ªå²å„‹è¦‹ç§¦ç»å…¬æ›°ï¼šã€Œç§¦å§‹èˆ‡å‘¨åˆï¼Œåˆè€Œé›¢ï¼Œäº”ç™¾æ­²ç•¶å¾©åˆï¼Œåˆåä¸ƒå¹´è€Œéœ¸ç‹å‡ºç„‰ã€‚ã€ æ«Ÿé™½é›¨é‡‘ï¼Œç§¦ç»å…¬è‡ªä»¥ç‚ºå¾—é‡‘ç‘ï¼Œæ•…ä½œç•¦ç•¤æ«Ÿé™½è€Œç¥€ç™½å¸ã€‚
Forty-eight years later, Zhou's grand historian Dan met Qin Xian Gong and said: 'Qin first combined with Zhou, then combined and separated; after five hundred years they should combine again; seventeen years after combining, a hegemon king will emerge.' It rained gold at Que Yang; Qin Xian Gong considered himself to have obtained the gold auspicious omen, therefore he made the Qi zhi altar at Que Yang and sacrificed to the White Emperor.

A hundred and twenty years later Qin extinguished Zhou, and Zhou's nine tripods entered Qin. Some say the Song Tai Qiu altar perished, and the tripods sank beneath the Si River at Peng Cheng.

A hundred and fifteen years later Qin united all under heaven.

ç§¦å§‹çš‡æ—¢å¹¶å¤©ä¸‹è€Œå¸ï¼Œæˆ–æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸å¾—åœŸå¾·ï¼Œé»ƒé¾åœ°è¾è¦‹ã€‚ å¤å¾—æœ¨å¾·ï¼Œé’é¾æ­¢æ–¼éƒŠï¼Œè‰æœ¨æš¢èŒ‚ã€‚ æ®·å¾—é‡‘å¾·ï¼ŒéŠ€è‡ªå±±æº¢ã€‚ å‘¨å¾—ç«å¾·ï¼Œæœ‰èµ¤çƒä¹‹ç¬¦ã€‚ ä»Šç§¦è®Šå‘¨ï¼Œæ°´å¾·ä¹‹æ™‚ã€‚ æ˜”ç§¦æ–‡å…¬å‡ºçµï¼Œç²é»‘é¾ï¼Œæ­¤å…¶æ°´å¾·ä¹‹ç‘ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ç§¦æ›´å‘½æ²³æ›°ã€Œå¾·æ°´ã€ï¼Œä»¥å†¬åæœˆç‚ºå¹´é¦–ï¼Œè‰²ä¸Šé»‘ï¼Œåº¦ä»¥å…­ç‚ºåï¼ŒéŸ³ä¸Šå¤§å‘‚ï¼Œäº‹çµ±ä¸Šæ³•ã€‚
After Qin Shi Huang united all under heaven and became emperor, some said: 'The Yellow Emperor obtained the earth virtue; yellow dragons and earthworms appeared. Xia obtained the wood virtue; green dragons stopped in the suburbs; grass and trees grew luxuriantly. Yin obtained the metal virtue; silver overflowed from the mountains. Zhou obtained the fire virtue; there was the omen of the red crow. Now Qin changes Zhou; it is the time of water virtue. Formerly Qin Wen Gong went hunting and obtained a black dragon; this is the auspicious sign of water virtue.' Thereupon Qin renamed the river 'Virtue Water'; made the tenth winter month the year's beginning; honored black as the color; named measures with six; honored Great Lu as the sound; governed affairs by honoring law.

å³å¸ä½ä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œæ±å·¡éƒ¡ç¸£ï¼Œç¥ é¨¶å¶§å±±ï¼Œé Œç§¦åŠŸæ¥­ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯å¾µå¾é½Šé­¯ä¹‹å„’ç”Ÿåšå£«ä¸ƒåäººï¼Œè‡³ä¹æ³°å±±ä¸‹ã€‚ è«¸å„’ç”Ÿæˆ–è­°æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤è€…å°ç¦ªç‚ºè’²è»Šï¼Œæƒ¡å‚·å±±ä¹‹åœŸçŸ³è‰æœ¨ï¼› åŸ½åœ°è€Œç¥­ï¼Œå¸­ç”¨è‘…ç¨­ï¼Œè¨€å…¶æ˜“éµä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ å§‹çš‡èæ­¤è­°å„ä¹–ç•°ï¼Œé›£æ–½ç”¨ï¼Œç”±æ­¤çµ€å„’ç”Ÿã€‚ è€Œé‚é™¤è»Šé“ï¼Œä¸Šè‡ªæ³°å±±é™½è‡³å·”ï¼Œç«‹çŸ³é Œç§¦å§‹çš‡å¸å¾·ï¼Œæ˜å…¶å¾—å°ä¹Ÿã€‚ å¾é™°é“ä¸‹ï¼Œç¦ªæ–¼æ¢çˆ¶ã€‚ å…¶ç¦®é —é‡‡å¤ªç¥ä¹‹ç¥€é›ä¸Šå¸æ‰€ç”¨ï¼Œè€Œå°è—çš†ç¥•ä¹‹ï¼Œä¸–ä¸å¾—è€Œè¨˜ä¹Ÿã€‚
Three years after ascending the emperor position, he toured the eastern commanderies and counties, sacrificed at Zou Yi Mountain, and praised Qin's achievements. Thereupon he summoned seventy Confucian scholars and doctors from Qi and Lu to follow him, arriving below Tai Mountain. Various Confucian scholars discussed, some saying: 'The ancients for feng and shan made cattail carts, hating to injure the mountain's soil, stones, grass, and trees; they swept the ground and sacrificed, used pickled straw for mats, saying it was easy to follow.' Shi Huang heard these discussions were all different and difficult to apply; from this he dismissed the Confucian scholars. Then he cleared a cart path, ascended from Tai Mountain's yang side to the peak, erected a stone praising Qin Shi Huang's virtue, making clear that he had obtained the feng. He descended by the yin path and performed shan at Liang Fu. The rites somewhat adopted what the Grand Invocator used in sacrificing to the Yong Supreme Deity; the feng and hidden matters were all kept secret; later generations could not obtain and record them.

å§‹çš‡ä¹‹ä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œä¸­é˜ªé‡æš´é¢¨é›¨ï¼Œä¼‘æ–¼å¤§æ¨¹ä¸‹ã€‚ è«¸å„’ç”Ÿæ—¢çµ€ï¼Œä¸å¾—èˆ‡ç”¨æ–¼å°äº‹ä¹‹ç¦®ï¼Œèå§‹çš‡é‡é¢¨é›¨ï¼Œå‰‡è­ä¹‹ã€‚
When Shi Huang ascended Tai Mountain, on the middle slope he encountered violent wind and rain, and rested beneath a large tree. The various Confucian scholars had already been dismissed and could not participate in the feng rites; when they heard Shi Huang encountered wind and rain, they ridiculed him.

æ–¼æ˜¯å§‹çš‡é‚æ±éŠæµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè¡Œç¦®ç¥ åå±±å¤§å·åŠå…«ç¥ï¼Œæ±‚åƒŠäººç¾¨é–€ä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ å…«ç¥å°‡è‡ªå¤è€Œæœ‰ä¹‹ï¼Œæˆ–æ›°å¤ªå…¬ä»¥ä¾†ä½œä¹‹ã€‚ é½Šæ‰€ä»¥ç‚ºé½Šï¼Œä»¥å¤©é½Šä¹Ÿã€‚ å…¶ç¥€çµ•è«çŸ¥èµ·æ™‚ã€‚ å…«ç¥ï¼šä¸€æ›°å¤©ä¸»ï¼Œç¥ å¤©é½Šã€‚ å¤©é½Šæ·µæ°´ï¼Œå±…è‡¨è‘å—éƒŠå±±ä¸‹è€…ã€‚ äºŒæ›°åœ°ä¸»ï¼Œç¥ æ³°å±±æ¢çˆ¶ã€‚ è“‹å¤©å¥½é™°ï¼Œç¥ ä¹‹å¿…æ–¼é«˜å±±ä¹‹ä¸‹ï¼Œå°å±±ä¹‹ä¸Šï¼Œå‘½æ›°ã€Œç•¤ã€ï¼› åœ°è²´é™½ï¼Œç¥­ä¹‹å¿…æ–¼æ¾¤ä¸­åœœä¸˜äº‘ã€‚ ä¸‰æ›°å…µä¸»ï¼Œç¥ èš©å°¤ã€‚ èš©å°¤åœ¨æ±å¹³é™¸ç›£é„‰ï¼Œé½Šä¹‹è¥¿å¢ƒä¹Ÿã€‚ å››æ›°é™°ä¸»ï¼Œç¥ ä¸‰å±±ã€‚ äº”æ›°é™½ä¸»ï¼Œç¥ ä¹‹ç½˜ã€‚ å…­æ›°æœˆä¸»ï¼Œç¥ ä¹‹èŠå±±ã€‚ çš†åœ¨é½ŠåŒ—ï¼Œå¹¶å‹ƒæµ·ã€‚ ä¸ƒæ›°æ—¥ä¸»ï¼Œç¥ æˆå±±ã€‚ æˆå±±æ–—å…¥æµ·ï¼Œæœ€å±…é½Šæ±åŒ—éš…ï¼Œä»¥è¿æ—¥å‡ºäº‘ã€‚ å…«æ›°å››æ™‚ä¸»ï¼Œç¥ ç‘¯é‚ªã€‚ ç‘¯é‚ªåœ¨é½Šæ±æ–¹ï¼Œè“‹æ­²ä¹‹æ‰€å§‹ã€‚ çš†å„ç”¨ä¸€ç‰¢å…·ç¥ ï¼Œè€Œå·«ç¥æ‰€æç›Šï¼Œçªå¹£é›œç•°ç„‰ã€‚
Thereupon Shi Huang toured east along the sea, performed rites and sacrificed to famous mountains, great rivers, and the eight spirits, seeking immortals and those of Xian Men's kind. The eight spirits have existed since ancient times, or some say they were made since Tai Gong. Qi is called Qi because of the heavenly Qi. Its sacrifices have ceased; no one knows when they began. The eight spirits: first, the heaven lord, sacrificed to at heaven Qi. Heaven Qi is the deep water that dwells below the mountain in Lin Zi's southern suburb. Second, the earth lord, sacrificed to at Tai Mountain Liang Fu. Heaven likes yin; sacrifice to it must be below high mountains and above small mountains; it is called a 'zhi'; earth values yang; sacrifice to it must be in the midst of marshes on round mounds, it is said. Third, the war lord, sacrificed to Chi You. Chi You is at Dong Ping Lu Jian xiang, on Qi's western border. Fourth, the yin lord, sacrificed to at the three mountains. Fifth, the yang lord, sacrificed to at Chi Fu. Sixth, the moon lord, sacrificed to at Lai Mountain. All are north of Qi, alongside the Bo Sea. Seventh, the sun lord, sacrificed to at Cheng Mountain. Cheng Mountain's ladle enters the sea; it dwells furthest in Qi's northeast corner, to welcome the sunrise, it is said. Eighth, the four seasons lord, sacrificed to at Lang Ya. Lang Ya is east of Qi, where the year begins. All each used one pen of implements for sacrifice, and the shamans and invokers added or subtracted according to their practices, with jade and coins mixed differently.

è‡ªé½Šå¨ã€å®£ä¹‹æ™‚ï¼Œé¨¶å­ä¹‹å¾’è«–è‘—çµ‚å§‹äº”å¾·ä¹‹é‹ï¼ŒåŠç§¦å¸è€Œé½Šäººå¥ä¹‹ï¼Œæ•…å§‹çš‡é‡‡ç”¨ä¹‹ã€‚ è€Œå®‹æ¯‹å¿Œã€æ­£ä¼¯åƒ‘ã€å……å°šã€ç¾¨é–€é«˜æœ€å¾Œçš†ç‡•äººï¼Œç‚ºæ–¹åƒŠé“ï¼Œå½¢è§£éŠ·åŒ–ï¼Œä¾æ–¼é¬¼ç¥ä¹‹äº‹ã€‚ é¨¶è¡ä»¥é™°é™½ä¸»é‹é¡¯æ–¼è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œè€Œç‡•é½Šæµ·ä¸Šä¹‹æ–¹å£«å‚³å…¶è¡“ä¸èƒ½é€šï¼Œç„¶å‰‡æ€ªè¿‚é˜¿è«›èŒåˆä¹‹å¾’è‡ªæ­¤èˆˆï¼Œä¸å¯å‹æ•¸ä¹Ÿã€‚
From Qi Wei and Xuan's time, Zou Zi's followers discussed and wrote about the cycle of the five virtues from end to beginning; when Qin became emperor, Qi people presented it, therefore Shi Huang adopted it. And Song Wu Ji, Zheng Bo Qiao, Chong Shang, Xian Men Gaoâ€”finally all Yan peopleâ€”made the fang xian way, with form dissolving and melting transformations, relying on ghosts and spirits affairs. Zou Yan became famous among the feudal lords for using yin and yang to govern movements; Yan and Qi's seaside fang shi transmitted his techniques but could not master them thoroughly; yet then the strange, circuitous, flattering, and compromising followers arose from this, numbering more than can be counted.

è‡ªå¨ã€å®£ã€ç‡•æ˜­ä½¿äººå…¥æµ·æ±‚è“¬èŠã€æ–¹ä¸ˆã€ç€›æ´²ã€‚ æ­¤ä¸‰ç¥å±±è€…ï¼Œå…¶å‚…åœ¨å‹ƒæµ·ä¸­ï¼Œå»äººä¸é ï¼› æ‚£ä¸”è‡³ï¼Œå‰‡èˆ¹é¢¨å¼•è€Œå»ã€‚ è“‹å˜—æœ‰è‡³è€…ï¼Œè«¸åƒŠäººåŠä¸æ­»ä¹‹è—¥çš†åœ¨ç„‰ã€‚ å…¶ç‰©ç¦½ç¸ç›¡ç™½ï¼Œè€Œé»ƒé‡‘éŠ€ç‚ºå®®é—•ã€‚ æœªè‡³ï¼Œæœ›ä¹‹å¦‚é›²ï¼› åŠåˆ°ï¼Œä¸‰ç¥å±±åå±…æ°´ä¸‹ã€‚ è‡¨ä¹‹ï¼Œé¢¨è¼’å¼•å»ï¼Œçµ‚è«èƒ½è‡³äº‘ã€‚ ä¸–ä¸»è«ä¸ç”˜å¿ƒç„‰ã€‚ åŠè‡³ç§¦å§‹çš‡å¹¶å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œè‡³æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œå‰‡æ–¹å£«è¨€ä¹‹ä¸å¯å‹æ•¸ã€‚ å§‹çš‡è‡ªä»¥ç‚ºè‡³æµ·ä¸Šè€Œæä¸åŠçŸ£ï¼Œä½¿äººä¹ƒé½ç«¥ç”·å¥³å…¥æµ·æ±‚ä¹‹ã€‚ èˆ¹äº¤æµ·ä¸­ï¼Œçš†ä»¥é¢¨ç‚ºè§£ï¼Œæ›°æœªèƒ½è‡³ï¼Œæœ›è¦‹ä¹‹ç„‰ã€‚ å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œå§‹çš‡å¾©æ¸¸æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè‡³ç‘¯é‚ªï¼Œéæ’å±±ï¼Œå¾ä¸Šé»¨æ­¸ã€‚ å¾Œä¸‰å¹´ï¼Œæ¸¸ç¢£çŸ³ï¼Œè€ƒå…¥æµ·æ–¹å£«ï¼Œå¾ä¸Šéƒ¡æ­¸ã€‚ å¾Œäº”å¹´ï¼Œå§‹çš‡å—è‡³æ¹˜å±±ï¼Œé‚ç™»æœƒç¨½ï¼Œå¹¶æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œå†€é‡æµ·ä¸­ä¸‰ç¥å±±ä¹‹å¥‡è—¥ã€‚ ä¸å¾—ï¼Œé‚„è‡³æ²™ä¸˜å´©ã€‚
From Wei, Xuan, and Yan Zhao, they sent people into the sea to seek Peng Lai, Fang Zhang, and Ying Zhou. These three spirit mountains, their accounts say they are in the midst of the Bo Sea, not far from people; When trouble is about to arrive, the wind leads the ship away. It is said there were once those who arrived; the various xian people and immortality medicines are all there. Their things, birds, and beasts are all white, and yellow gold and silver form palaces and gates. Before arriving, gazing at it is like clouds; when you arrive, the three spirit mountains instead dwell below the water. When approaching it, the wind always leads it away; in the end no one can arrive, it is said. No generation's lords were not wholeheartedly devoted to it. When Qin Shi Huang united all under heaven and arrived at the seaside, the fang shi spoke of it more than could be counted. Shi Huang himself thought that having arrived at the seaside he feared not reaching it, so he sent people carrying boys and girls into the sea to seek it. The ships crossed in the midst of the sea, all using wind as their explanation, saying they had not yet been able to arrive, but had gazed and seen it there. The next year, Shi Huang again toured the seaside, arriving at Lang Ya, passing Heng Mountain, returning from Shang Dang. Three years later, he toured Jie Shi, examined the fang shi who entered the sea, returning from Shang Jun. Five years later, Shi Huang went south to Xiang Mountain, then ascended Kui Ji, traveled along the seaside, hoping to encounter the strange medicines of the three spirit mountains in the sea. Not obtaining them, he returned to Sha Qiu and collapsed.

äºŒä¸–å…ƒå¹´ï¼Œæ±å·¡ç¢£çŸ³ï¼Œå¹¶æµ·å—ï¼Œæ­·æ³°å±±ï¼Œè‡³æœƒç¨½ï¼Œçš†ç¦®ç¥ ä¹‹ï¼Œè€Œåˆ»å‹’å§‹çš‡æ‰€ç«‹çŸ³æ›¸æ—ï¼Œä»¥ç« å§‹çš‡ä¹‹åŠŸå¾·ã€‚ å…¶ç§‹ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯ç•”ç§¦ã€‚ ä¸‰å¹´è€ŒäºŒä¸–å¼’æ­»ã€‚
In Er Shi's first year, he toured east to Jie Shi, traveled along the south of the Hai, passed Tai Mountain, arrived at Kui Ji, performed ritual sacrifices to all of them, and carved alongside the stone writings that Shi Huang had established, to display Shi Huang's merits and virtues. That autumn, the feudal lords rebelled against Qin. Three years later Er Shi was assassinated and died.

å§‹çš‡å°ç¦ªä¹‹å¾ŒåäºŒæ­²ï¼Œç§¦äº¡ã€‚ è«¸å„’ç”Ÿç–¾ç§¦ç„šè©©æ›¸ï¼Œèª…åƒ‡æ–‡å­¸ï¼Œç™¾å§“æ€¨å…¶æ³•ï¼Œå¤©ä¸‹ç•”ä¹‹ï¼Œçš†è¨›æ›°ï¼šã€Œå§‹çš‡ä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œç‚ºæš´é¢¨é›¨æ‰€æ“Šï¼Œä¸å¾—å°ç¦ªã€‚ã€ æ­¤è±ˆæ‰€è¬‚ç„¡å…¶å¾·è€Œç”¨äº‹è€…é‚ªï¼Ÿ
Twelve years after Shi Huang's feng and shan, Qin perished. The various Confucian scholars hated that Qin burned the poems and books, executed and punished the literati; the common people resented its laws; all under heaven rebelled against it; all falsely claimed: 'Shi Huang ascended Tai Mountain, was struck by violent wind and rain, could not obtain the feng and shan.' Was this not what is called performing the rites without the proper virtue?

æ˜”ä¸‰ä»£ä¹‹ï¼ˆå›ï¼‰ï¼»å±…ï¼½çš†åœ¨æ²³æ´›ä¹‹é–’ï¼Œæ•…åµ©é«˜ç‚ºä¸­å¶½ï¼Œè€Œå››å¶½å„å¦‚å…¶æ–¹ï¼Œå››ç€†å’¸åœ¨å±±æ±ã€‚ è‡³ç§¦ç¨±å¸ï¼Œéƒ½å’¸é™½ï¼Œå‰‡äº”å¶½ã€å››ç€†çš†å¹¶åœ¨æ±æ–¹ã€‚ è‡ªäº”å¸ä»¥è‡³ç§¦ï¼Œè»¼èˆˆè»¼è¡°ï¼Œåå±±å¤§å·æˆ–åœ¨è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œæˆ–åœ¨å¤©å­ï¼Œå…¶ç¦®æç›Šä¸–æ®Šï¼Œä¸å¯å‹è¨˜ã€‚ åŠç§¦å¹¶å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œä»¤ç¥ å®˜æ‰€å¸¸å¥‰å¤©åœ°åå±±å¤§å·é¬¼ç¥å¯å¾—è€Œåºä¹Ÿã€‚
The residences of the former three dynasties were all between the He and Luo rivers; therefore Song Gao was the central peak, and the four peaks were each in their proper directions, with the four rivers all east of the mountains. When Qin became emperor and made Xian Yang its capital, then the five peaks and four rivers were all together in the east. From the five emperors to Qin, they intermittently rose and declined; famous mountains and great rivers were sometimes under feudal lords, sometimes under the Son of Heaven; their rites were diminished or increased, differing by generations, and cannot all be recorded. When Qin united all under heaven, it commanded the sacrifice officials to constantly offer to heaven, earth, famous mountains, great rivers, and ghosts and spirits, which could be obtained and ordered.

Only the Yong four zhi Supreme Deity was honored; its light and scenes moved the people only at Chen Bao. Therefore for the Yong four zhi: in spring they performed the yearly pray following ice thaw; in autumn dry ice; in winter dam sacrifice; in fifth month taste colt; and in the four mid months monthly sacrifices; when Chen Bao section came, one sacrifice. In spring and summer they used xing horses; in autumn and winter liu horses. Four zhi colts, one team of wooden yu dragon luan chariots, one team of wooden yu chariot horses, each according to their emperor's color. Four yellow calves and lambs each, jade and coins in specific numbers, all buried alive, without sacrificial vessel implements. Once every three years they performed the suburban sacrifice. Qin made the winter tenth month the year's beginning, therefore they constantly performed the suburban audience on the first night of the tenth month, passed the authority fire, bowed at Xian Yang's side, and wore upper white clothing; its procedures were like the regular sacrifices, it is said. The west zhi and qi zhi were sacrificed to as before; the emperor did not go personally.

When Han rose, during Gao Zu's humble time, he once killed a big snake. Something said: 'The snake is the White Emperor's son, and the one who killed it is the Red Emperor's son.' In the second year, he attacked Xiang Ji to the east and returned entering the pass, asking: 'In former Qin times, what emperor did the Supreme Deity sacrifices honor?' This year, the decree said: 'I have been on the throne thirteen years to now, relying on the ancestral temple's spirit and the she and ji's fortune; within the realm there is peaceful calm; the people have no illnesses. Recently there have been abundant harvests for several years; through my lack of virtue, how can I enjoy this? It is all due to the Supreme Deity and various spirits' grant.' I have heard that the ancients, when enjoying virtue, must repay merit; I wish to increase the various spirits' sacrifices. The officials discussed increasing the Yong five zhi altars with road carriages each one team, harness covers and equipment; The west zhi, qi zhi, and yu carriages each one team, yu horses four teams, harness covers and equipment; For the river, Jiao, and Han water sacrifices, add two jades each; And for the various sacrifices, each broaden the altar grounds, adding gui, currency, zu, and dou according to their rank. The Lu man Gong Sun Chen presented a memorial saying: 'Originally Qin obtained water virtue; now Han has received it. According to the end-beginning transmission, Han should have earth virtue; earth virtue's response is the appearance of a yellow dragon. We should correct the calendar's beginning month, change the garment colors, with yellow as the top color.' At this time Chancellor Zhang Cang favored the pitchpipe calendar, thinking that Han was the beginning of water virtue; therefore the river bursting the Jin dike was its omen. The year beginning in the winter tenth month, with colors black outside and red inside, corresponded to the virtue. As Gong Sun Chen said, it was wrong. They dismissed him. Three years later, a yellow dragon appeared at Cheng Ji. Emperor Wen then summoned Gong Sun Chen, appointed him as a scholar, and with the various scholars drafted matters of changing the calendar and garment colors. That summer, he issued an edict saying: 'A strange spirit appeared at Cheng Ji, with no harm to the people; the year has an abundant harvest. I have prayed at the suburban sacrifice to the Supreme Deity and various spirits; let the ritual officials discuss it, without taboo to trouble me.' The officials all said: 'In ancient times the Son of Heaven in summer personally performed the suburban sacrifice, sacrificing to the Supreme Deity at the suburban altar; therefore it is called suburban.' Thereupon in the summer fourth month, Emperor Wen began the suburban appearance at the Yong five zhi sacrifices, with all garments having red as the top color.

At this time Li Shao Jun also appeared before the emperor with methods of sacrificing to the stove, valley way, and dispelling old age; the emperor honored him. His travels with methods reached all the feudal lords. He had no wife or children. People heard of his ability to make things happen and achieve immortality; moreover they presented him gifts, constantly leaving surplus gold, money, clothing, and food. People all thought he did not manage any livelihood occupation yet was abundantly provided for; moreover they did not know from what place he came; they believed more and contended to serve him. Shao Jun naturally loved methods and was good at skillfully initiating extraordinary successes. Once he drank with Marquis Wu An; in the seat there was a man over ninety. Shao Jun then spoke of places where he had toured and shot with his grandfather. The old man, when a child, had followed his grandfather and knew those places; the whole seat was startled. Shao Jun appeared before the emperor; the emperor had an old bronze vessel and asked Shao Jun about it. Shao Jun said: 'This vessel was displayed in the bo chamber in Qi Huan Gong's tenth year.' Afterwards, the Son of Heaven's park had a white deer; with its hide he made currency, issued auspicious responses, and made white gold there.

The next year, at the Yong suburban sacrifice, they obtained a one-horned beast, like a mi deer. The officials said: 'Your Majesty has solemnly and respectfully performed the suburban sacrifice; the Supreme Deity has repaid and enjoyed it, granting a one-horned beastâ€”surely it is a qilin.' Thereupon he presented it to the five zhi, each zhi adding one cow for liao burning. He granted white gold to the feudal lords, instructing that the omen response united with heaven.

Thereupon the Ji Bei King thought the Son of Heaven was about to perform feng shan, so he presented a memorial offering Tai Mountain and its neighboring walled cities; the Son of Heaven compensated him with other counties. The Chang Shan King had committed a crime and was banished; the Son of Heaven sealed his younger brother at Zhen Ding to continue the former king's sacrifices, and made Chang Shan a commandery. The next year, the Qi man Shao Weng appeared before the emperor with ghost and spirit methods. The emperor had a favored Lady Wang who had passed away; Shao Weng with his method reportedly brought Lady Wang and stove ghost appearances by night. The Son of Heaven gazed and saw them from within his curtains. Thereupon he appointed Shao Weng as Wen Cheng General, with very many rewards and grants, treating him with guest rites. Wen Cheng said: 'The emperor now wishes to communicate with the spirits; the palace chambers and garments do not resemble the spirits, so spirit things will not arrive.' Then he made painted cloud qi carriages, and each drove carriages on victorious days to ward off evil ghosts. He again made Gan Quan Palace, in the midst made tower chambers, painted heaven, earth, Tai Yi, and various ghost spirits, and placed sacrifice implements to attract heaven spirits. After more than a year, his methods increasingly declined; the spirits did not arrive. Then he made silk writings and fed them to a cow, appearing not to know, saying 'there is something strange in this cow's belly.' They killed and examined the cow, obtaining the writings; the writings said very strange things. The Son of Heaven recognized his handwriting; he questioned the person, and indeed it was false writing. Thereupon he executed Wen Cheng General and concealed it.

The year after Wen Cheng died, the Son of Heaven became very ill at Ding Hu; shamans and doctors were brought without exception, but he was not cured. You Shui Fa Gen said that Shang Commandery had a shaman who, when ill, had ghost spirits descend upon him. The emperor summoned and placed him in sacrifice at Gan Quan. When he became ill, he sent someone to ask the spirit lord. The spirit lord said: 'The Son of Heaven need not worry about the illness. When the illness is a little better, forcibly meet with me at Gan Quan.' Thereupon the illness was cured; he then rose and went to Gan Quan, where the illness was completely gone. There was a great amnesty, and the longevity palace spirit lord was established. The longevity palace spirit lord's most noble was Tai Yi; his assistants were called great prohibition, Si Ming, and such; all followed him. She could not be seen; one heard her words, which were equal to a person's voice. She sometimes left and sometimes came; when she came, the wind became solemn. She dwelt in the midst of the chamber curtains. She sometimes spoke during the day, but constantly at night. The Son of Heaven purified himself, then entered. He made the shaman the host, who cared for the food and drink. Whatever she said went below (was recorded). He again established the longevity palace and north palace, spread feather flags, set supply implements, to perform rites to the spirit lord. What the spirit lord spoke, the emperor had people receive and write down her words, naming it 'painted method.' What she spoke was what the world's customs knew; there was nothing extremely different, yet the Son of Heaven's heart alone was happy. Its matters were secret; no one in the world knew of them.

Three years later, the officials said that yuan should be named with heaven's auspicious signs, not with one-two numbers. The first yuan was called 'Establish'; the second yuan with the long star was called 'Light'; the third yuan with the suburban one-horned beast was called 'Hunt,' they say.

The next year in winter, the Son of Heaven performed the suburban sacrifice at Yong and discussed, saying: 'Now I personally perform the suburban sacrifice to the Supreme Deity, but Hou Tu has no sacrifice; then the rites do not correspond.' The officials discussed with the Grand Historian and sacrifice official Kuan Shu: 'Heaven and earth's sacrificial animals have horns like cocoons and chestnuts. Now Your Majesty personally sacrifices to Hou Tu; Hou Tu should have five altars in a round mound in the marsh midst, each altar with one yellow calf tai lao implements; after sacrifice completely bury them, and the followers' sacrifice garments have yellow on top.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven went east and began establishing the Hou Tu sacrifice at Fen Yin's Wei Hill, as Kuan Shu and others had discussed. The emperor personally gazed and bowed, like the Supreme Deity rites. The rites completed, the Son of Heaven then arrived at Xing Yang and returned. Passing through Luo Yang, he issued an edict saying: 'The three dynasties are distantly extinguished; it is far already difficult to preserve them. We should seal the Zhou successor with thirty li of land as Zhou Zi Nan Jun, to offer their ancestor sacrifices there.' This year, the Son of Heaven began touring the commanderies and counties, approaching and seeking at Tai Mountain.

That spring, Marquis Yue Cheng presented a memorial speaking of Luan Da. Luan Da was a Jiao Dong palace attendant who formerly studied with Wen Cheng General under the same teacher, and afterwards became the Jiao Dong King's recipe maker. And Marquis Yue Cheng's sister was King Kang's queen, with no children. King Kang died; another concubine's son was established as king. And Queen Kang had licentious conduct; she did not get along with the king and they mutually endangered each other with the law. Queen Kang heard that Wen Cheng had already died and wished to charm the emperor herself, so she sent Luan Da through Marquis Yue Cheng to seek an audience and speak of methods. The Son of Heaven had already executed Wen Cheng; afterwards he regretted his early death and pitied that his methods were not exhausted; when he saw Luan Da, he was greatly pleased. Da was tall and beautiful as a person; his speech had many methods and strategies, and he dared to make great claims and handle them without doubt. Da said: 'Your minister constantly came and went in the sea midst and saw An Qi, Xian Men, and such. But they considered your minister base and did not trust me. Again they thought King Kang was only a feudal lord and not worth sharing methods with. Your minister frequently spoke to King Kang, but King Kang again did not employ me. My teacher said: 'Gold can be made, river breaches can be blocked, immortality medicine can be obtained, immortals can be summoned.' However your minister feared following Wen Cheng's example, then all method masters would shut their mouths; how would they dare speak of methods!' The emperor said: 'Wen Cheng only died from eating horse liver. If you can truly practice his methods, what do I have to cherish!' Da said: 'My teacher did not seek people; people sought him. If Your Majesty certainly wishes to bring them, then honor their envoys, give them relatives, treat them with guest rites, do not treat them lowly, make each wear their trust seals, then they can communicate words to the spirits. Will the spirits still be willing or not? Bring honor to their envoys, then they can be brought.' Thereupon the emperor had him test small methods; fighting chess pieces struck each other.

At this time the emperor above was worried about the river breach, and gold was not completed, so he appointed Da as Five Benefits General. After more than a month, he obtained four seals, wearing the Heaven Master General, Earth Master General, and Great Passage General seals. He formulated an edict to the Imperial Secretary: 'Formerly Yu dredged the nine rivers and breached the four waterways. Recently the river overflowed Gao Lu; dike labor has not ceased. I have ruled all under heaven for twenty-eight years; heaven as if left me a master who greatly passes through. Qian calls 'flying dragon', 'great goose advances to bank'; my intention is perhaps with that. We should seal Earth Master General Da with two thousand households as Le Tong Hou.' He granted ranked marquis armor mansions and a thousand servants. He rode in carriages and expanded carriages, horses, curtains, canopies, and vessels to fill his house. He again married him to Wei Chang Princess, presented ten thousand jin of gold, and moreover named his walled city Dang Li Princess. The Son of Heaven personally went to the Five Benefits mansion. Envoys inquired and provided supplies, connected along the road. From the great princess and generals ministers below, all set wine at his house and presented gifts to him. Thereupon the Son of Heaven again carved a jade seal called 'Heaven Way General', had the envoy wear feather garments and stand on white thatch at night; the Five Benefits General also wore feather garments and stood on white thatch at night to receive the seal, to show he was not a minister. And the one wearing 'Heaven Way' would moreover guide heaven spirits for the Son of Heaven. Thereupon Five Benefits constantly sacrificed at night in his house, wishing to bring down spirits. The spirits had not arrived but a hundred ghosts had gathered; however he could quite make them do things. Afterwards he equipped and regulated his travel, entered the sea to the east, seeking his teacher they say. Da appeared for several months, wore six seals, nobility shook all under heaven, and between Yan and Qi above the sea, none did not grasp and claim to have forbidden methods and could become spirit immortals.

In the midst of the summer sixth month, Fen Yin shaman Jin sacrificed to Hou Tu at Wei Wei for the people beside the camp; he saw the ground in a hook shape, dug and looked, obtaining a ding. The ding was greatly different from ordinary dings; its patterns were engraved but without inscription marks. He wondered at it and spoke to the officials. The officials reported to He Dong Grand Governor Sheng, and Sheng reported it. The Son of Heaven had an envoy verify and question the shaman who obtained the dingâ€”no deceit or fraudâ€”so he sacrificed with rites, welcomed the ding to Gan Quan, followed on the journey, and the emperor presented it. When they arrived at Zhong Shan, the sun was warm; there was a yellow cloud covering it. A mi deer passed by; the emperor personally shot it and used it in sacrifice they say. When they arrived at Chang An, all the ministers and grand masters discussed and requested that the treasure ding be honored. The Son of Heaven said: 'Recently the river overflowed; several years were not abundant. Therefore I toured and sacrificed to Hou Tu, praying for the common people to grow grain. Now the abundant harvest has not been repaid; why has the ding emerged?' The officials all said: 'We have heard that formerly the Great Emperor raised one spirit ding; the one signified unification, the end to which heaven, earth, and the ten thousand things are tied. Only those who received the mandate and became emperors know its intent in their hearts and unite with virtue there. The ding should appear at the ancestor ni and be hidden in the emperor's court, to unite with the bright response.' The decree said: 'Acceptable.'

That autumn, the emperor went to Yong, about to perform the suburban sacrifice. Some said: 'The five emperors are Tai Yi's assistants; we should establish Tai Yi and the emperor personally perform the suburban sacrifice to it.' The emperor doubted and was not decided. The Qi man Gong Sun Qing said: 'This year we obtained the treasure ding; its winter Xin Si new moon dawn winter solstice equals the Yellow Emperor's time.' Qing had a bamboo book that said: 'The Yellow Emperor obtained the treasure ding at Wan Qu and asked Ghost Yu Qu. Ghost Yu Qu replied: 'The Emperor obtained the treasure ding and spirit tally; this year Ji You new moon dawn winter solstice obtained heaven's record, ending and beginning again.' Thereupon the Yellow Emperor welcomed the sun and pushed the tally; afterwards every twenty years again new moon dawn winter solstice, altogether twenty pushes, three hundred eighty years, the Yellow Emperor immortal ascended to heaven.' Qing wished to memorial it through Suo Zhong. Suo Zhong viewed its book as not regular and doubted it was a wild book; he declined saying: 'The treasure ding matters are already decided; what more can be done!' Qing memorialed it through a favored person. The emperor was greatly pleased and then summoned and questioned Qing. He replied: 'I received this book from Shen Gong; Shen Gong has already died.' The emperor said: 'What kind of person was Shen Gong?' Qing said: 'Shen Gong was a Qi person. He communicated with An Qi Sheng and received the Yellow Emperor's words; he had no books, only this ding book. It said 'The Han rise again should be in the Yellow Emperor's time.' It said 'The Han sage is in Gao Zu's grandson and great grandson. The treasure ding emerges and communicates with spirits, perform feng shan. Feng shan seventy-two kings, only the Yellow Emperor got to ascend Tai Mountain for feng.' Shen Gong said: 'The Han ruler should also ascend for feng; ascending for feng can make one immortal and ascend to heaven. In the Yellow Emperor's time there were ten thousand feudal lords, and spirit bright feng resided at seven thousand. All under heaven has eight famous mountains; three are in barbarian yi lands, five in the central states. The central states' Hua Mountain, Shou Mountain, Tai Shi, Tai Mountain, Dong Laiâ€”these five mountains the Yellow Emperor constantly toured and met with spirits. The Yellow Emperor fought and learned immortality. He worried about common people who did not follow his way, so he beheaded and executed those who were not ghost spirits. After a hundred-some years he then got to communicate with spirits. The Yellow Emperor performed suburban sacrifice at Yong to the Supreme Deity and lodged three months. Ghost Yu Qu was styled Great Hong; he died and was buried at Yong, therefore Hong Tomb is it. Afterwards the Yellow Emperor received the ten thousand spirits at the bright court. The bright court was Gan Quan. The so-called cold gate was valley mouth. The Yellow Emperor gathered copper from Shou Mountain and cast the ding below Jing Mountain. When the ding was completed, there was a dragon that hung its whiskers below to welcome the Yellow Emperor. The Yellow Emperor ascended and rode; the group of ministers and later palace attendants who followed and ascended were seventy-some people; the dragon then ascended and went. The remaining small ministers did not get to ascend, so they all held the dragon whiskers; the dragon whiskers were pulled, fell, and dropped the Yellow Emperor's bow. The common people looked up as the Yellow Emperor ascended to heaven, then embraced his bow and whiskers and wailed; therefore later generations named that place Ding Lake and his bow Wu Hao.'' Thereupon the Son of Heaven said: 'Alas! If I could truly be like the Yellow Emperor, I would view leaving my wife and children as easily as taking off shoes.' Then he appointed Qing as a gentleman and sent him east to await spirits at Tai Shi.

He then commanded Yue shamans to establish Yue wish sacrifices; settled platforms without altars; also sacrificed to heaven spirits, the Supreme Deity, and the hundred ghosts; and divined with chickens. The emperor believed it; Yue sacrifices and chicken divination began to be used.

å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€ŒåƒŠäººå¯è¦‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸Šå¾€å¸¸é½ï¼Œä»¥æ•…ä¸è¦‹ã€‚ ä»Šé™›ä¸‹å¯ç‚ºè§€ï¼Œå¦‚ç·±åŸï¼Œç½®è„¯æ£—ï¼Œç¥äººå®œå¯è‡´ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä¸”åƒŠäººå¥½æ¨“å±…ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šä»¤é•·å®‰å‰‡ä½œèœšå»‰æ¡‚è§€ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰å‰‡ä½œç›Šå»¶å£½è§€ï¼Œä½¿å¿æŒç¯€è¨­å…·è€Œå€™ç¥äººã€‚ ä¹ƒä½œé€šå¤©è–è‡ºï¼Œç½®ç¥ å…·å…¶ä¸‹ï¼Œå°‡æ‹›ä¾†åƒŠç¥äººä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ç”˜æ³‰æ›´ç½®å‰æ®¿ï¼Œå§‹å»£è«¸å®®å®¤ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œæœ‰èŠç”Ÿæ®¿æˆ¿å…§ä¸­ã€‚ å¤©å­ç‚ºå¡æ²³ï¼Œèˆˆé€šå¤©è‡ºï¼Œè‹¥è¦‹æœ‰å…‰äº‘ï¼Œä¹ƒä¸‹è©”ï¼šã€Œç”˜æ³‰æˆ¿ä¸­ç”ŸèŠä¹è–ï¼Œèµ¦å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œæ¯‹æœ‰å¾©ä½œã€‚ã€
Gong Sun Qing said: 'Immortals can be seen; the emperor went often hastily; because of this they were not seen. Now Your Majesty can make a pavilion like Gou city, place fu and jujubes; spirit people should be able to be brought.' Moreover immortals like tower dwellings.' Thereupon the emperor commanded Chang An to make the Fei Lian Gui pavilion and Gan Quan to make the Yi Yan Shou pavilion; he made Qing hold the tally and set implements to await spirit people. He then made the Tong Tian Jing platform and placed sacrifice implements below it, intending to summon immortal and spirit people. Thereupon Gan Quan again placed the front hall and began broadening the various palace chambers. In summer, mushrooms were born in the hall room's inner midst. The Son of Heaven for blocking the river raised the Tong Tian platform; as if he saw there was light, they say; he then issued an edict: 'Gan Quan room midst has born nine mushroom stems; amnesty all under heaven; no repeat work.'

å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œä¼æœé®®ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œæ—±ã€‚ å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚å°å‰‡å¤©æ—±ï¼Œä¹¾å°ä¸‰å¹´ã€‚ã€ ä¸Šä¹ƒä¸‹è©”æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©æ—±ï¼Œæ„ä¹¾å°ä¹ï¼Ÿ å…¶ä»¤å¤©ä¸‹å°Šç¥ éˆæ˜Ÿç„‰ã€‚ã€
The next year, he attacked Chao Xian. In summer, drought. Gong Sun Qing said: 'In Yellow Emperor's time when feng was performed then heaven had drought; dry feng three years.' The emperor then issued an edict saying: 'Heaven has drought; is it thinking of dry feng? We should command all under heaven to honor and sacrifice to the spirit star there.'

å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œä¸ŠéƒŠé›ï¼Œé€šå›ä¸­é“ï¼Œå·¡ä¹‹ã€‚ æ˜¥ï¼Œè‡³é³´æ¾¤ï¼Œå¾è¥¿æ²³æ­¸ã€‚
The next year, the emperor performed suburban sacrifice at Yong, opened the Hui Zhong way, and toured it. In spring, he arrived at Ming Ze and returned following the Xi He.

The next year in winter, the emperor toured the Nan commandery, arrived at Jiang Ling and went east. He ascended and performed rites at Qian's Tian Zhu Mountain, styling it Nan Yue. He floated on the Jiang, from Xun Yang exited at Cong Yang, passed Peng Li, and performed rites to its famous mountains and rivers. He arrived north at Lang Ye, following above the sea. In the fourth month's midst, he arrived at Feng Gao and repaired the feng there.

åˆï¼Œå¤©å­å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œæ³°å±±æ±åŒ—é˜¯å¤æ™‚æœ‰æ˜å ‚è™•ï¼Œè™•éšªä¸æ•ã€‚ ä¸Šæ¬²æ²»æ˜å ‚å¥‰é«˜æ—ï¼Œæœªæ›‰å…¶åˆ¶åº¦ã€‚ æ¿Ÿå—äººå…¬çŠå¸¶ä¸Šé»ƒå¸æ™‚æ˜å ‚åœ–ã€‚ æ˜å ‚åœ–ä¸­æœ‰ä¸€æ®¿ï¼Œå››é¢ç„¡å£ï¼Œä»¥èŒ…è“‹ï¼Œé€šæ°´ï¼Œåœœå®®å£ç‚ºè¤‡é“ï¼Œä¸Šæœ‰æ¨“ï¼Œå¾è¥¿å—å…¥ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ˜†ä¾–ï¼Œå¤©å­å¾ä¹‹å…¥ï¼Œä»¥æ‹œç¥ ä¸Šå¸ç„‰ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šä»¤å¥‰é«˜ä½œæ˜å ‚æ±¶ä¸Šï¼Œå¦‚å¸¶åœ–ã€‚ åŠäº”å¹´ä¿®å°ï¼Œå‰‡ç¥ å¤ªä¸€ã€äº”å¸æ–¼æ˜å ‚ä¸Šåï¼Œä»¤é«˜çš‡å¸ç¥ åå°ä¹‹ã€‚ ç¥ ååœŸæ–¼ä¸‹æˆ¿ï¼Œä»¥äºŒåå¤ªç‰¢ã€‚ å¤©å­å¾æ˜†ä¾–é“å…¥ï¼Œå§‹æ‹œæ˜å ‚å¦‚éƒŠç¦®ã€‚ ç¦®ç•¢ï¼Œç‡å ‚ä¸‹ã€‚ è€Œä¸Šåˆä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œè‡ªæœ‰ç¥•ç¥ å…¶å·”ã€‚ è€Œæ³°å±±ä¸‹ç¥ äº”å¸ï¼Œå„å¦‚å…¶æ–¹ï¼Œé»ƒå¸å¹¶èµ¤å¸ï¼Œè€Œæœ‰å¸ä¾ç¥ ç„‰ã€‚ å±±ä¸Šèˆ‰ç«ï¼Œä¸‹æ‚‰æ‡‰ä¹‹ã€‚
Initially, when the Son of Heaven performed feng at Tai Mountain, Tai Mountain's northeast zi in ancient times had a bright hall place; the place was dangerous and not spacious. The emperor wished to repair the bright hall beside Feng Gao, but had not yet clarified its system and regulations. The Ji Nan man Gong Yu Dai presented a bright hall diagram from Yellow Emperor's time. The bright hall diagram had one hall in the midst, four sides without walls, covered with thatch, connected to water, round palace wall made into a covered way, above had a tower, entered from the southwest, named Kun Lun; the Son of Heaven followed it and entered, to bow and sacrifice to the Supreme Deity there. Thereupon the emperor commanded Feng Gao to make the bright hall above Wen, like Dai's diagram. And when five years later repairing the feng, then sacrificed to Tai Yi and the five emperors at the bright hall's upper seat, commanded Gao emperor's sacrifice seat to face it. Sacrificed to Hou Tu at the lower chamber, with twenty tai lao. The Son of Heaven followed the Kun Lun way and entered, began bowing to the bright hall like suburban rites. The rites completed, liao burned below the hall. And the emperor again ascended Tai Mountain, himself having a secret sacrifice at its peak. And below Tai Mountain sacrificed to the five emperors, each according to their direction; the Yellow Emperor combined with the Red Emperor, and the officials served the sacrifice there. Above the mountain raised fire, below all responded to it.

å…¶å¾ŒäºŒæ­²ï¼Œåä¸€æœˆç”²å­æœ”æ—¦å†¬è‡³ï¼Œæ¨æ­·è€…ä»¥æœ¬çµ±ã€‚ å¤©å­è¦ªè‡³æ³°å±±ï¼Œä»¥åä¸€æœˆç”²å­æœ”æ—¦å†¬è‡³æ—¥ç¥ ä¸Šå¸æ˜å ‚ï¼Œæ¯‹ä¿®å°ç¦ªã€‚ å…¶è´Šé¥—æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©å¢æˆçš‡å¸å¤ªå…ƒç¥ç­–ï¼Œå‘¨è€Œå¾©å§‹ã€‚ çš‡å¸æ•¬æ‹œå¤ªä¸€ã€‚ã€ æ±è‡³æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè€ƒå…¥æµ·åŠæ–¹å£«æ±‚ç¥è€…ï¼Œè«é©—ï¼Œç„¶ç›Šé£ï¼Œå†€é‡ä¹‹ã€‚
Two years later, in the eleventh month Jia Zi new moon dawn winter solstice, the calendar pushers used the original system. The Son of Heaven personally arrived at Tai Mountain, on the eleventh month Jia Zi new moon dawn winter solstice day sacrificed to the Supreme Deity at the bright hall, without repairing feng shan. Its zan xiang said: 'Heaven increased and bestowed on the emperor the Tai Yuan spirit tally, cycled and began again. The emperor respectfully bowed to Tai Yi.' He arrived east above the sea; examined those who entered the sea and method masters who sought spirits; none were verified, however he increased dispatches, hoping to encounter them.

In the eleventh month Yi You, the Cypress Beam had a disaster. On the twelfth month Jia Wu new moon, the emperor personally performed shan at Gao Li, sacrificing to Hou Tu. He faced Bo Hai, about to gaze and sacrifice to Peng Lai's kind, hoping to arrive at the special court there.

The emperor returned; because of the Cypress Beam disaster, he received tallies in the morning at Gan Quan. Gong Sun Qing said: 'The Yellow Emperor approached the Qing Ling Platform; twelve days it burned; the Yellow Emperor then repaired the bright court. The bright court was Gan Quan.' The method masters often said that ancient emperor kings had capitals at Gan Quan. Afterwards the Son of Heaven again received the feudal lords at Gan Quan; Gan Quan made feudal lords' mansions. Yong Zhi then said: 'Yue customs have fire disasters; again raising houses must be with large ones, use to overcome and subdue it.' Thereupon he made the Jian Zhang Palace, measured as having thousand gates and ten thousand houses. The front hall was measured as high as Wei Yang. To the east was the Phoenix Tower, over twenty zhang high. To the west was Tangzhong, with tiger enclosures spanning several dozen li. To the north, he had a large pool excavated, with a pavilion over twenty zhang high, named Taiye Pool. Within it were Penglai, Fangzhang, Yingzhou, and Hulu islands, modeled after the divine mountains and turtles and fish in the sea. To the south were the Jade Hall, the Jade Gate, and structures shaped like great birds. Then he established the Spirit Bright Terrace and Well Shaft Tower, measured at fifty zhang, with palanquin ways connected there.

In summer, the Han changed the calendar, making the first month the beginning of the year, and the color above yellow; official names and seal characters were changed with five words, making it the Tai Chu first year. This year, they campaigned west against Da Yuan. A great locust plague arose. Lady Ding, Yu Chu of Luo Yang, and others used methods to sacrifice and curse the Xiongnu and Da Yuan.

The next year, the officials presented a memorial that Yong's five zhi lacked lao and ripe equipment, and fragrant fragrances were not prepared. Then he commanded the sacrifice officials to advance calf lao equipment for the zhi, with colors and foods that conquered, and used wooden yu horses to substitute for colts. Only in the fifth month they tasted colts; when conducting the personal suburban sacrifice they used colts. And for all the famous mountains and rivers that used colts, they all substituted wooden yu horses. When the performance was over, then they used colts. Other rites were as before.

å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œæ±å·¡æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè€ƒç¥åƒŠä¹‹å±¬ï¼Œæœªæœ‰é©—è€…ã€‚ æ–¹å£«æœ‰è¨€ã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚ç‚ºäº”åŸåäºŒæ¨“ï¼Œä»¥å€™ç¥äººæ–¼åŸ·æœŸï¼Œå‘½æ›°è¿å¹´ã€ã€‚ ä¸Šè¨±ä½œä¹‹å¦‚æ–¹ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ˜å¹´ã€‚ ä¸Šè¦ªç¦®ç¥ ä¸Šå¸ç„‰ã€‚
The next year, he toured east above the sea, examining the spirit immortals and their kind, but there were none who had been verified. The method masters said: 'In the Yellow Emperor's time they made five cities and twelve towers, to await spirit people at the Holding Period, named Welcoming Year.' The emperor permitted making it according to the method, naming it Welcoming Year. The emperor personally performed rites and sacrificed to the Supreme Deity there.

å…¬çŠå¸¶æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚é›–å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç„¶é¢¨åã€å°å·¨ã€å²ä¼¯ä»¤é»ƒå¸å°æ±æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªå‡¡å±±ï¼Œåˆç¬¦ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œä¸æ­»ç„‰ã€‚ã€ å¤©å­æ—¢ä»¤è¨­ç¥ å…·ï¼Œè‡³æ±æ³°å±±ï¼Œï¼»æ±ï¼½æ³°å±±å‘å°ï¼Œä¸ç¨±å…¶è²ï¼Œä¹ƒä»¤ç¥ å®˜ç¦®ä¹‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸å°ç¦ªç„‰ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä»¤å¸¶å¥‰ç¥ å€™ç¥ç‰©ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œé‚é‚„æ³°å±±ï¼Œä¿®äº”å¹´ä¹‹ç¦®å¦‚å‰ï¼Œè€ŒåŠ ä»¥ç¦ªç¥ çŸ³é–­ã€‚ çŸ³é–­è€…ï¼Œåœ¨æ³°å±±ä¸‹é˜¯å—æ–¹ï¼Œæ–¹å£«å¤šè¨€æ­¤åƒŠäººä¹‹é–­ä¹Ÿï¼Œæ•…ä¸Šè¦ªç¦ªç„‰ã€‚
Gong Yu Dai said: 'Although in the Yellow Emperor's time they performed feng at Tai Mountain, Feng Hou, Feng Ju, and Qi Bo commanded the Yellow Emperor to perform feng at East Tai Mountain, shan at Fan Mountain, unite the tally, and only then would he not die.' The Son of Heaven had already commanded the setting up of sacrifice equipment, arrived at East Tai Mountain; East Tai Mountain was low and small, not matching its reputation, so he commanded the sacrifice officials to perform rites to it, but did not perform feng shan there. Afterwards he commanded Dai to serve the sacrifice and await spirit things. In summer, he then returned to Tai Mountain, performed the five-year rites like before, and added a shan sacrifice at Stone Gate. Stone Gate was at Tai Mountain's lower zi in the south; the method masters often said this was the gate of the immortal people, therefore the emperor personally performed shan there.

Five years later, he again arrived at Tai Mountain and repaired the feng. On his return he passed by and sacrificed at Heng Mountain.

ä»Šå¤©å­æ‰€èˆˆç¥ ï¼Œå¤ªä¸€ã€ååœŸï¼Œä¸‰å¹´è¦ªéƒŠç¥ ï¼Œå»ºæ¼¢å®¶å°ç¦ªï¼Œäº”å¹´ä¸€ä¿®å°ã€‚ è–„å¿Œå¤ªä¸€åŠä¸‰ä¸€ã€å†¥ç¾Šã€é¦¬è¡Œã€èµ¤æ˜Ÿï¼Œäº”ï¼Œå¯¬èˆ’ä¹‹ç¥ å®˜ä»¥æ­²æ™‚è‡´ç¦®ã€‚ å‡¡å…­ç¥ ï¼Œçš†å¤ªç¥é ˜ä¹‹ã€‚ è‡³å¦‚å…«ç¥è«¸ç¥ï¼Œæ˜å¹´ã€å‡¡å±±ä»–åç¥ ï¼Œè¡Œéå‰‡ç¥ ï¼Œè¡Œå»å‰‡å·²ã€‚ æ–¹å£«æ‰€èˆˆç¥ ï¼Œå„è‡ªä¸»ï¼Œå…¶äººçµ‚å‰‡å·²ï¼Œç¥ å®˜ä¸ä¸»ã€‚ ä»–ç¥ çš†å¦‚å…¶æ•…ã€‚ ä»Šä¸Šå°ç¦ªï¼Œå…¶å¾ŒåäºŒæ­²è€Œé‚„ï¼Œéæ–¼äº”å²³ã€å››ç€†çŸ£ã€‚ è€Œæ–¹å£«ä¹‹å€™ç¥ ç¥äººï¼Œå…¥æµ·æ±‚è“¬èŠï¼Œçµ‚ç„¡æœ‰é©—ã€‚ è€Œå…¬å­«å¿ä¹‹å€™ç¥è€…ï¼ŒçŒ¶ä»¥å¤§äººä¹‹è·¡ç‚ºè§£ï¼Œç„¡æœ‰æ•ˆã€‚ å¤©å­ç›Šæ€ å­æ–¹å£«ä¹‹æ€ªè¿‚èªçŸ£ï¼Œç„¶ç¾ˆç¸»ä¸çµ•ï¼Œå†€é‡å…¶çœŸã€‚ è‡ªæ­¤ä¹‹å¾Œï¼Œæ–¹å£«è¨€ç¥ç¥ è€…å½Œçœ¾ï¼Œç„¶å…¶æ•ˆå¯ç¹çŸ£ã€‚ å¤ªå²å…¬æ›°ï¼šä½™å¾å·¡ç¥­å¤©åœ°è«¸ç¥åå±±å·è€Œå°ç¦ªç„‰ã€‚ å…¥å£½å®®ä¾ç¥ ç¥èªï¼Œç©¶è§€æ–¹å£«ç¥ å®˜ä¹‹æ„ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯é€€è€Œè«–æ¬¡è‡ªå¤ä»¥ä¾†ç”¨äº‹æ–¼é¬¼ç¥è€…ï¼Œå…·è¦‹å…¶è¡¨è£ã€‚ å¾Œæœ‰å›å­ï¼Œå¾—ä»¥è¦½ç„‰ã€‚ è‹¥è‡³ä¿è±†çªå¹£ä¹‹è©³ï¼Œç»é…¬ä¹‹ç¦®ï¼Œå‰‡æœ‰å¸å­˜ã€‚
Now the sacrifices established by the Son of Heaven were Tai Yi and Hou Tu; every three years he personally performed suburban sacrifices, established the Han house feng shan, and every five years once repaired the feng. Bo Ji Tai Yi and the Three Ones, Dark Sheep, Horse Travel, Red Starâ€”five in totalâ€”Kuan Shu's sacrifice officials presented rites according to the seasons of the year. Altogether six sacrifices, all were led by the Grand Blessing. As for the eight spirits and various spirits, Welcoming Year, Fan Mountain and other named sacrifices, when he traveled past them he sacrificed, when he traveled on he stopped. The sacrifices established by method masters, each was self-managed; when the person ended, then it stopped; the sacrifice officials did not manage them. Other sacrifices were all as before. Now the emperor performed feng shan; twelve years later he returned, having been universal to the five peaks and four waterways. And the method masters who awaited and sacrificed to spirit people, entered the sea seeking Peng Lai, but in the end none had verification. And Gong Sun Qing's spirit-awaiters still used the tracks of great persons as explanations, but none had any effect. The Son of Heaven increasingly grew weary and disgusted with the method masters' strange and circuitous words, however he kept them restrained but not cut off, hoping to encounter their true ones. From this time afterwards, the method masters who spoke of spirit sacrifices became increasingly many, however their effects could be clearly seen. The Grand Historian said: I followed along as we toured and sacrificed to the heaven, earth, various spirits, famous mountains and rivers, and performed feng shan there. I entered the Longevity Palace and served the sacrifice spirit words; I thoroughly observed the intentions of the method masters and sacrifice officials; thereupon I withdrew and arranged in order those who had used matters with ghosts and spirits from ancient times onward, fully seeing their exterior and interior. Afterwards, superior men could obtain to view it there. If it comes to the details of zu, dou, gui, and bi, the rites of xian and chou, then the officials preserve them.
